details.description: Diabetes is a medical condition you may need to tell DVLA about
details.body:
You may need to tell DVLA about your diabetes, depending on how it’s treated and the licence you have.

Diabetes treated by tablets

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. For further information read leaflet ‘TAB1’.

Download ‘TAB1 - Information for drivers with diabetes treated by non-insulin medication, diet, or both’ (PDF, 224KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form ‘DIAB1V’ and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘DIAB1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 315KB)

If you want to apply for vocational entitlement to drive larger vehicles (C1, C1E, D1, DIE, C, CE, D or DE) download leaflet ‘INS186’ to find out how.

Download ‘INS186 - A guide for drivers with diabetes who wish to apply for Vocational Entitlement’ (PDF, 230KB)

Diabetes treated by insulin

Car or motorcycle licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form ‘DIAB1’ and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘DIAB1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 315KB)

You can find help and guidance on filling in the DIAB1 questionnaire in ‘A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form’.

Download ‘A guide to filling in your DIAB1 medical form’ (PDF, 414KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form ‘DIAB1V’ and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

Download ‘DIAB1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 315KB)

If you want to apply for vocational entitlement to drive larger vehicles (C1, C1E, D1, DIE, C, CE, D or DE) download leaflet ‘INS186’ to find out how.

Download ‘INS186 - A guide for drivers with diabetes who wish to apply for Vocational Entitlement’ (PDF, 230KB)

Further information on the standards and requirements for drivers with diabetes treated with insulin can be found on the Department for Transport website.

Diabetes treated by diet

Car or motorcycle licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. For further information please read leaflet ‘TAB1’.

Download ‘TAB1 - Information for drivers with diabetes treated by non-insulin medication, diet, or both’ (PDF, 224KB)

Bus, coach or lorry licence

You don’t need to tell DVLA. For further information read leaflet ‘VDIET’ (‘Lorry and/or bus drivers with diabetes treated by diet alone’) for more information.

Download ‘VDIET - Lorry and/or bus drivers with diabetes treated by diet alone’ (PDF, 130KB)

If you want to apply for vocational entitlement to drive larger vehicles (C1, C1E, D1, DIE, C, CE, D or DE) download leaflet ‘INS186’ to find out how.

Download ‘INS186 - A guide for drivers with diabetes who wish to apply for Vocational Entitlement’ (PDF, 230KB)
